ðŸš€ gdown | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading public files and folders from Google Drive, especially large files or when standard tools like curl/wget fail due to Google Drive's specific download protocols and security measures.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Skip Google Drive security notices for large files â€¢ Recursive download of Google Drive folders (up to 50 files per folder)
ðŸ“– Summary: gdown is a Python-based command-line and library tool designed to download public files and folders from Google Drive. It overcomes limitations of tools like curl and wget by handling Google Drive's security notices for large files, enabling recursive folder downloads, and allowing specification of download formats for Google Docs, Sheets, and Slides.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ floccus | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Synchronizing browser bookmarks privately across multiple browsers and devices using a user-chosen cloud storage provider.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Syncs native browser bookmarks directly â€¢ Supports sync via Nextcloud Bookmarks, Linkwarden, KaraKeep, Google Drive, Git servers, and WebDAV â€¢ Compatible with browsers supporting Web extensions (Firefox, Chrome, Edge, etc.) â€¢ Offers an Android/iOS app for mobile access â€¢ Allows multiple sync profiles
ðŸ“– Summary: Floccus is a browser extension that synchronizes your bookmarks privately across different browsers and devices. It supports various cloud storage services and WebDAV-compatible providers, allowing for customizable sync strategies and intervals.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ kimi-cli | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To act as an AI agent within the terminal, assisting developers with coding, shell commands, and other development-related tasks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Shell command mode for direct terminal command execution â€¢ VS Code extension for seamless integration â€¢ IDE integration via Agent Client Protocol (ACP) â€¢ Zsh integration for enhanced shell experience â€¢ Support for Model Context Protocol (MCP) tools
ðŸ“– Summary: Kimi Code CLI is an AI-powered command-line agent designed to assist with software development tasks and terminal operations. It can read and edit code, execute shell commands, fetch web content, and autonomously plan actions, integrating with various IDEs and shells.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ ai-agents-from-scratch | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Educational resource for learning the fundamental concepts and implementation details of AI agents by building them locally, without relying on high-level frameworks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Build AI agents from first principles â€¢ Utilize local LLMs (via node-llama-cpp) â€¢ Understand function calling, memory, and ReAct patterns â€¢ Demystify agent architectures and framework design choices
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a hands-on, step-by-step guide to building AI agents from scratch using local LLMs and Node.js. It demystifies agent architecture, function calling, memory, and ReAct patterns by explaining design decisions and visualizing internal processes, aiming to build a deep understanding before utilizing production frameworks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ DumpGuard | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Security research and testing of credential extraction techniques on Windows systems, particularly in environments with Credential Guard enabled.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Extracts NTLMv1 hashes from user sessions. â€¢ Bypasses local Credential Guard using the Remote Credential Guard protocol. â€¢ Supports dumping own session credentials without elevated privileges (requires SPN account). â€¢ Supports dumping all session credentials with SYSTEM privileges (requires SPN account).
ðŸ“– Summary: DumpGuard is a proof-of-concept C tool designed to extract NTLMv1 credential hashes from modern Windows systems. It leverages the Remote Credential Guard protocol to bypass local Credential Guard protections, enabling credential dumping even when Credential Guard is enabled.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
